description: Number of Sophie Germain primes <= Prime[ 10^n ].
comments: Sophie Germain primes are primes p such that 2p+1 is also prime.
links: Index entries for sequences related to numbers of primes in various ranges
example: The first 10 primes are 2,3,5,7,11,13,17,23,29 and 31. 6 of these are Sophie Germain primes, namely: 2,3,5,11,23 and 29.
mathematica: << NumberTheory`NumberTheoryFunctions`; cnt = 0; currentPrime = 1; For[ i = 1, i == i, i ++, currentPrime = NextPrime[ currentPrime ]; If[ PrimeQ[ 2*currentPrime + 1 ], cnt++ ]; If[ IntegerQ[ Log[ 10, i ] ], Print[ cnt ] ]; ]
author: Dennis S. Kluk (mathemagician(AT)ameritech.net)
